inlineContent.text: Welcome to the Basic Proxying tutorial! In this comprehensive guide, you’ll learn how to inspect your app in greater detail and effectively collaborate with back-end developers by sending cURL requests and responses. You’ll also discover how to map network traffic, use breakpoints to manipulate data on-the-fly, and leverage the Repeat tool to resend requests without client involvement. Prepare to dive deep into the world of network debugging and enhance your skills in proxying and app inspection.
To best help back-end developers exactly understand what happened, send either the whole session or the
to get a cURL for any request you’ve got/
Try to use CURL in terminal to see if you get the same result back in terminal
Try to see if you could map all the traffics to be forwarded from
Use Map Remote functionality to map everythings to go through to differnt url
See if everythings went well and you still get the same results in your apps and you app still working as before.
Trying to fix a back-end issue? By using
and manipulating the data on the air, you can simulate any states that might come from your back-end server.
feature and try to change the
and get different data in app
Try to change a name of one film to something else like this.
the app by modifying the data type, or do it for fun :-)
feature and try to change the
and get different data in app.
You could try to change the api, and get the
instead to see what would happen.
When you test back-end code, you might want to examine the server’s response without involving your client. The
makes this easy. Enable it by right-clicking on any request, then choosing Repeat.
In this scenario, Proxy app resends the exact same request to the server and shows you the response as a new request without taking any action on your client. This happens only once by default.
Keep the Repeat tool in mind when it’s difficult to navigate to the location where a request gets sent in the client interface. Once you have one example request, use Repeat to send it again.

abstract.text: Welcome to the Advanced Usage tutorial, where you’ll learn how to master this powerful tool to take your network debugging skills to the next level! In this comprehensive guide, you’ll discover how to save, import, and export requests and responses, map local responses, simulate various network conditions, manage block/allow lists, and explore extra features exclusive to certain network debugging tools. Get ready to become a network debugging expert and make your app development process even more efficient.

Welcome to the Advanced Usage tutorial, where you’ll learn how to master this powerful tool to take your network debugging skills to the next level! In this comprehensive guide, you’ll discover how to save, import, and export requests and responses, map local responses, simulate various network conditions, manage block/allow lists, and explore extra features exclusive to certain network debugging tools. Get ready to become a network debugging expert and make your app development process even more efficient.

Welcome to the Ultimate Network Debugging Tutorial! In this tutorial, you’ll learn a variety of techniques to debug network-related issues in your app. To get started, you’ll first download a sample project from GitHub that will serve as a practical example for applying the concepts covered in this tutorial.

Welcome to the Advanced Usage tutorial, where you’ll learn how to master this powerful tool to take your network debugging skills to the next level! In this comprehensive guide, you’ll discover how to save, import, and export requests and responses, map local responses, simulate various network conditions, manage block/allow lists, and explore extra features exclusive to certain network debugging tools. Get ready to become a network debugging expert and make your app development process even more efficient.

Welcome to the App Inspection tutorial! In this brief yet informative guide, you’ll learn how to track all network traffic on your device and inspect the details of requests and responses going through www.swapi.dev. Get ready to enhance your network debugging capabilities by mastering the art of app inspection with powerful tools like Proxyman and Charles.
